Welcome to Sac State's Data Science Club


Our mission is to bring together Sac State students who are interested in data science to learn more about different technologies and tools, and make some really cool projects!


About Us

Projects

News

Contact Us

About Us


Data Science is the intersection of computer science, math, statistics, and machine learning.


The purpose of the club is to give students a background on data science through lectures and discussions, connect with alumni working as data scientists, and have hangouts to work on projects to build your resume and learn new concepts.


Our tentative plan is meet in Riverside 5029 from 12-1 on Monday, starting this Fall, however we haven't set a meeting day yet! This may change though so please follow this page for updates, we're also very active on our facebook group found at the bottom of the page.


We're usually in Riverside 5029 5-11pm on Friday's if you want to hang out and work on some projects, data related or not!


A link to the planned topics can be found here

A link to some great data science resources can be found here

Projects


^^^ Hover!

March Madness Predictor

Visualization tool to rank teams by their offensive and defensive ability. Built in ~14 hours for CSUS ECS Open House.

Clean Sac

311 Data collection visualization tool. Can view incident heatmaps by type filters and by cluster location. Built at Hack4Sac.

Couch Coder

Couch Coder is a IDE for google docs that supports syntax highlighting! Built at HackDavis, won best dev tool.

Iidata Timed Contest

A 3 hour timed data analysis contest at UC Davis Statistics Club's data science conference where we won first place.
